revised_title: Awards and Achievements in Mathematics, Spectroscopy, and Ionospheric Physics
tldr: The article highlights the accomplishments of J. E. Littlewood, Sir Thomas Merton, and H. S. W. Massey in their respective fields of mathematics, spectroscopy, and ionospheric physics. Littlewood is recognized for his contributions to pure mathematics, Merton for his work in spectroscopy, and Massey for his research in ionospheric physics and negative ions. The article also mentions Hodgkin's research on nerve impulses and their electrical activity.
